website_summaries.verdict: Offers durability, fantastic arch support, and daylong comfort, and features a single strap for easy-to-use adjustment.
pros: Comfortable and functional, these shoes provide more stability without the feeling of too much tightness around your toe
cons: They can run narrow for people with wider feet, and if they're not tight enough, they can cause blisters

customer_reviews.title: Recieved a defective product.
customer_reviews.text: I am completely apauld by the product I recieved from this company. I was charged $104.95 for what I thought was a new pair of sandals. They were obviously worn more than a couple of times previously, which like I said, I thought I was buying a brand new pair of sandals. No where were these sandals advertised as "used". There is mudd stuck on the sole of both sandals. They smell like feet. The worst part is that the back strap on the right sandal is completely cut in half so I couldnt wear these if I wanted to.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Studeman

customer_reviews.title: Authentic Chacos
customer_reviews.text: i have a few other pairs of chacos—you can never have too many! i think these are my FAVE! they are so plain and simple but SUPER cute. i am glad they came in a Chaco box, including the ‘how to’ booklet, and have the chaco barcode on the tags on the sandals themselves. i compared them to my other chacos and everything seemed how it should be! phew. i am relieved that these are authentic. sometimes you never know with amazon! only reason i bought them from here was Prime shipping is unbeatable! haha overall happy. thanks amazon!
customer_reviews.author: hannah

customer_reviews.title: Always got blisters
customer_reviews.text: I could not find a way for these shoes to not give me blisters. I read online that they need to be broken in and shaped to your foot but I could never get them to brake in even after wearing them for multiple days. In the end I gave up and gave them to a friend. I wanted to love these so much but couldn't. The two positives of the shoes are the vibrant color straps and sturdiness of the sole. I bet these would be great for walking long distances if they were able to be broken in.
customer_reviews.author: ALyssa O'Bryan

customer_reviews.title: All straps are adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: Diggin' these sandals! If you're having issues with the straps, keep in mind ALL of them adjust. Start pulling around and you'll see. 100% adjustable. I will say I may need to have the back ankle strap pulled in, my heel sits a tad far back (chacos are repairable and you can have the straps adjusted). Overall happy with this purchase and look forward to breaking these guys in this summer! I wear a size 10-11 and ordered the 10 which fits perfectly. I recommend watching review videos so you can hear details about each style before you buy as well it helps.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Fox

customer_reviews.title: After wearing my Chaco's all day the first day, ...
customer_reviews.text: After wearing my Chaco's all day the first day, I cleaned out my closet and donated every pair of sandals that I have ever purchased because the fit and comfort of my Chaco's are supreme! These are the only sandals that I will ever purchase in the future and I plan on purchasing a lot more of them!!! I give them five stars all the way!
customer_reviews.author: judie cahill

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these sandals after researching arch support sandals. I wasn’t crazy about the look at first but they did grow on me. Shoes are very comfortable and the straps are easy to adjust (I did have to play with them a little to get the perfect fit). I have narrow feet and after reading reviews did order a size 7, even though I normally wear an 8. Sandals fit great maybe just a tad short in the back but I didn’t want something too big. I would suggest trying on first. So far shoes seem very comfortable and durable and I think these will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Love my Chacos!
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a 6.5-7W in shoes, but I have a pair of kid's Chacos in 4 that fit me perfectly, and my daughter has a women's 7 that are a bit too long, so I purchased the 6W and they are a perfect fit! This is my 2nd pair of Z Classic Sandals and I have 2 pair of Chaco leather sandals - they are pricey but worth the money - my first pair of Z Classic sandals lasted me almost 10 years of VERY heavy wear in the summertime. They are my go-to shoes for beach, lakes, hiking, walking around town, pretty much anything and everything.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs FantTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Plantars Fasciitis Relief
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist recommended Chacos after I complained about pain after wearing my sandals when we had a warm spring day. Thanks to Amazon I snagged a pair for under $100 and they have been amazing. At first I thought they were too small. I was devastated. The brilliant thing about Chacos is that the straps adjust to custom fit your foot. Brilliant technology! These provide amazing arch support and make walking much more comfortable. I'm probably going to sell all my other sandals and buy more Chacos for every occasion. They're that good.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable, a bit large
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear 7 or 7.5 in sandals, but even these 7's are too big. My heel sits pretty far back which isn't adjustable, and there's quite a bit of room at my toes. Not nearly as comfortable and light feeling as my Teva Verra sandals, so I'll go back to those. Love the adjustable straps, but the sandals with double straps are a little more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: hkf

customer_reviews.title: Not the most comfortable for me
customer_reviews.text: Maybe these particular shoes just aren't for me. I really like them and still wear them a lot, however, the arch must be too high for me. Months later they still cause some discomfort. Also the straps are incredibly hard to figure out how to loosen and tighten. I've stopped wearing the toe strap part of this shoe. I just slide my big toes on top of the strap. Otherwise they get strangled!
customer_reviews.author: Bella Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable footbed (once you break them in
customer_reviews.text: I used to wear Keen Venice H2 sandals as my outdoor/hiking sandal, after 4 years they broke so I decided to opt for the more fashionable outdoor sandal and splurge on some chacos. Pros: Definitely more stylish, I can wear these into a bar (granted it's Seattle) and still feel kind of cute. Comfortable footbed (once you break them in, took me ~25 mi walking/hiking) Cons: Problems with chaffing when I wore them walking for a whole day, as well as bad chaffing if you get them in the water. Conclusion- even though they are cuter, I'm going to wear these as causal sandals and switch back to the Keen Venice H2s for summer hiking!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce L

customer_reviews.title: Super heavy slightly overpriced toe loop too loose with no way to tighter good comfort
customer_reviews.text: This product is heavy! The tread and sole are good and comfortable but the shoes themselves are abnormally heavy like steal toed boots heavy. They fit great except the toe loop is way to loose on my toe and theyre is no way to tighten that look. It was slightly overpriced as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Baker

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love them, as they were recommended to me
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I found the toe circle dug into the crease between my toes and I couldn't wear them more than an hour. I really wanted to love them, as they were recommended to me. When I took them off, the straps left marks on my feet too. I tried loosening them, but I think they automatically tighten for a secure fit, so that did not help. Length was perfect even though I wear a 7 1/2 and ordered a 7. I do not have wide nor tall feet, just average. Guess the flip flops are the only Chaco's I can wear, as i tried the ones without the toe circle and the straps also felt tight.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, glad I gave them a try
customer_reviews.text: I teach high school and all the girls have a pair of these so I thought I'd give them a try. I have worn Birkenstock sandals the past two years and like them a lot for their arch support. These are similar, but not quite as supportive. They are easier to cinch up and loosen up than I imagined them to be, which is nice. Overall I'm pleased, not sure if they will match or surpass the Birkenstocks, but we will see over time.
customer_reviews.author: Jordana Runck

customer_reviews.title: Love chacos and amazon!
customer_reviews.text: I love chacos. I have had one pair for four years and I decided it’s time to get a new pair, not because they are broken but because I want something new. These chacos came in authentic, new, not worn, and were only $68!! That’s almost 50% off! In real box with directions to loosen or tighten! I’m in love! I have had my eye on these specific chacos for forever and I’m so happy I finally have them!
customer_reviews.author: The Spann’s

customer_reviews.title: Not as Expected :(
customer_reviews.text: Was sooo excited to get these, but they weren’t what I expected. The material isn’t as soft and squishy like I expected it to be; it’s prickly and hard under the foot. It is not very easy to adjust the fit either. I can’t pull the straps while it’s on my full easy enough to get it to fit right. They are also bulkier than I expected. Item being returned...continuing my search.
customer_reviews.author: BEegirl

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking and walking
customer_reviews.text: I love, love these chaco sandals. They are very comfortable to walk in for hours. BUT, you have to make sure that you adjust the straps to your exact comfort level and foot size. It takes a little bit of time to get the straps tweaked just right, but after that, no problems. They have a good cushion and feel good on the arches. They might be slightly narrow for my foot because the strap across can get a little snug. A small adjustment there and they are fine. They are athletically stylish. I love to walk and hike and these are just the thing.
customer_reviews.author: Julie M Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great supporting shoe
customer_reviews.text: Also go down a size or half size in Chacos! You want them to fit toe to heel so the supports are in the right spots. Also takes a couple of solid weeks to break in. Give it time it’s worth it!
customer_reviews.author: kevans15

customer_reviews.title: too narrow
customer_reviews.text: I loved the color and quality of these sandals. Unfortunately they are too narrow for my foot and I do not wear wide shoes. There is a "lifted' edge on the soles of the sandals that would probably help with arch support but in my case my palms of my feet are uncomfortably place on that lifted edge. Had to return. Other than that they were great as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Celina

customer_reviews.title: In love
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of Chacos and I can safely say I will be buying several more pairs. They’re so, so comfortable! A little tricky to adjust but I expected that for my first pair. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Zurilee

customer_reviews.title: Foot fits the sole but back strap very loose and non-adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Just received mine in the mail and I'm slightly disappointed in the sizing. Very comfortable once I got tightening the straps down but the back strap cannot be adjusted which causes the sandals to clipclop when I walk. I normally wear a 9.5, average width feet and based on the reviews, ordered up to a 10. The sole fits my feet wonderfully but the back strap is so loose Im worried it will leave blisters on the back of my heels. Has anyone else had this problem?
customer_reviews.author: RWM

customer_reviews.title: Runs half a size large
customer_reviews.text: I have worn this same brand and style of sandal before, but they finally wore out so I purchased a new pair. I found that the size 7 I have always worn was about a half size too large with this pair. The back strap was too long and on the left shoe the strap was longer than the right. So I trimmed it and seared the ends so they wouldn’t fray. Overall they’re OK, just disappointed in the fit. I would have returned them but I live outside the U.S. and it costs more to return something than the purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn bonbons

customer_reviews.title: Comfort, safety, durability and no blisters.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so comfortable as walking shoes. After a 7 month stay this yr. I put many miles walking in Mexico. Streets there have cobble stone roads and uneven streets, consequently, safety is my number one issue. This will be my second pair. The first pair are faring well too. I would purchase them again
customer_reviews.author: rparellatn

customer_reviews.title: ouch
customer_reviews.text: Straps not fully adjustable (one was) and the toe was really tight and overall really uncomfortable. even got the wide size, and it was just awful. cute though?
customer_reviews.author: Colbinda

customer_reviews.title: With all the hype I was expecting to love these. Turns out
customer_reviews.text: With all the hype I was expecting to love these. Turns out, they are going back. First, the sole is hard...unbendable, which means your foot moves around in the sandal. Second, although length was fine, the strap around the toe was tight and the strap along the outer edge was tight across my little toe. I do not have wide or fat feet either. At least I can say I tried 'em, but I'll stick with Taos and Sketcher.
customer_reviews.author: CherylK

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected, don't order up
customer_reviews.text: I'm normally a 9 in flats and most of my sandals are a 9 1/2 or 10 so I ordered a 10 and they fit in the middle but there was some slack in the toe and on the back. I returned them and plan on ordering a 9 so I'll update when they come in. The 9 came in and they're a little tight in the middle but I'm sure that will stretch out with time. If you're unsure, order the smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: love that all straps are adjustable for perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I have had many people rave about Chaco's and now I know why. They offer really good support and the straps are fully adjustable for the perfect fit. I will be using these for my trip to the Galapagos in January and know they will be perfect for hiking and for use in the water. My only complaint is, that in spite of other people reviewing differently, I had to size down. I am a 7 1/2, ordered an 8 and they were huge. I returned for size 7 and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Laborde

customer_reviews.title: Wear an 8 1/2 and sized up not down
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear an 8 1/2 and sized down to an 8 as some reviews suggested. The 8 was ok, but my heel was as far back as it could go, and my toes had little extra space. I went up to a 9, and they are much better. My only gripe is that the there is lots of extra strap hanging down once I adjust everything. I may just find a way to fold it under. Chacos came highly recommended by my outdoorsy brother and sister in law; I look forward to testing them out in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Torrey

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color shipped
customer_reviews.text: I was shipped a different color than I ordered and the one I received wasn't the one it shows here. It's like they just grabbed a size 8 and shipped it...regardless of the color. As for the size, my daughter has a regular width foot, for all her shoes. So, I did not order a wide. However, the regular 8 was too narrow. In the future, when I order Chaco's from Zappos or from the Chaco Website (never from amazon again. Apparently shoes aren't their thing) I will order a wide width for her. Length was as expected.
customer_reviews.author: review4u

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sandal
customer_reviews.text: I have rectangular feet and the option to adjust the straps give you wiggle room. The color is super cute and very comfortable arch support. Getting used to adjusting the straps too a while for me to get just right but once it was right, it was like putting on a mold. Highly recommend for those who wear a lot of sandals and spend time outsid. Easy rinse and wear.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy A.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Design, Straps Tough to Loosen
customer_reviews.text: This has to be about the worst design of shoe. Over time the straps gets too tight around my big toe and as much as I pull and tug on the straps they are soooo difficult to loosen up. I would like to return these and get some Keen's but already passed my return window. I would suggest getting the ones without the toe loop or get Keen's.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli D. White

customer_reviews.title: Reconsider this style :(
customer_reviews.text: Overall not bad. Hiked a steep mountain with these & did not nick my toes on the rocks. Only issues are the soles (footbed) of the sandals, slightly bulges up. The first few days were uncomfortable. & both, Footbed & outsole were very slippery when wet. I would not recommend this particular style with the toe loop; best to buy one that wraps the entire foot.
customer_reviews.author: Harlow

customer_reviews.title: Funny fit
customer_reviews.text: I chose the women's 12 as that should be a men's 11 they fit weird . I thought you had to get used to the adjustment of the strap but not so sure maybe I should have bought the men's 11 but I liked the color of these so I tried .I really wanted to try the toe strap to hold my foot in position not sure if I will try these again I have two pair of Chacon shoes which I really like for bike and hiking .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They hold up really well and are easy to wash off
customer_reviews.text: These sandals fir perfectly. This is my second pair. There is nothing wrong with my first pair, I just want a different color to choose from. You can wear these sandals and never have sore feet. I have worn them walking all over Boston and DC. They hold up really well and are easy to wash off. I would definitely recommend these sandals to everyone. They are well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Pam G.

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the lake, not for the ocean. Overall, not that easy or comfy.
customer_reviews.text: These sandals are heavy and quite structured. There's no Velcro so you have to loosen and tighten the straps to take them on and off. I wore them on a camping trip to a very rocky lake and they were great at protecting my feet walking in and out of the water. I wore them to the ocean and they cut my skin both where the straps cross near the toe and on the side of the foot. I think sand and wet straps caused the cuts, but overall I'm disappointed in this shoe and will look for a different brand for recreation.
customer_reviews.author: Myra J.

customer_reviews.title: Adjust them correctly and voila!
customer_reviews.text: I like the arch support, and the ability to adjust them as needed. These aren’t designed to be out of the box comfortable, and they require a break in period. I followed the instructions on Chaco’s website, and allowed a break in period. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: After slipping and busting my (you know what) at the creek I decided it was time to purchase these for my hikes. I love all the adjustments you can make to these. After you get the straps to your comfort level these sandals have a custom feel that’s fantastic. They dry quickly, hold their shape and clean up easily. Best news, I haven’t slipped once.
customer_reviews.author: Trish N.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to know what all the hype was about. Got them to wear on my sisters sailboat. Honestly... Just a fad and not worth the inflated money. The arch is very high and make my feet ache after wearing more than a few hours. Seriously considering returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Runs small, runs big
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of chacos a few years ago and wanted to get a new pair as that pair is getting worn out, so I ordered the same size I currently own. However, this pair is significantly smaller even though it's the same size- I compared them on and off my feet. I ordered the next size up thinking that they would be perfect, and they're too big! The size 6 pair I currently own are slightly larger than the 6 I bought, and the same amount smaller than the size 7 I bought. So frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Seonaid

customer_reviews.title: Sole Shredded After Minimal Use
customer_reviews.text: This was the first pair of Chaco sandals I've bought and I couldn't be more disappointed. The sole is shredded after only wearing them for two months. The most physical activity I performed in these sandals was mowing the grass... I know people who have hiked miles with Chaco sandals on. I am not sure why these ones shredded in the sole so quickly, but its very disappointing because I bought them for the durability. I reached out to Chaco for some assistance and haven't heard from them in over a week. Probably wont spend the money again for a weak product and non-existent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: straps shift and tighten on my toes as I walk
customer_reviews.text: My cousin recommended this brand. The VERY adjustable straps shift as I walk and end up strangling my toes. I will go back to Tevas which adjust on top, but don't have straps that slide around within the sole.
customer_reviews.author: julesofdew

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: I wear these every day. Love how sturdy yet comfortable. Lots of compliments on the colors too. Very versatile shoes. They’re the best for my plantar fasciitis. Much less pain from standing and walking around for a couple hours.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Cotton

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING....
customer_reviews.text: In and out of water playing and hiking is amazing, you can run jump and play on wet surfaces and they have awesome traction, they are comfy, amazing quality, and a great color. I got the green ones. They fit wide feet, and big feet. I love how easily adjustable they are. I love chacos.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these!!!
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but these shoes were so awful that I feel compelled to. I bought these last year and only wore them briefly once or twice. I went on an approx. 2 mile walk in these the other day and I now have 8 HUGE blisters on my feet one of which became infected and I’m now on antibiotics. Please do not buy these. I spent $100 on these shoes and I so regret it. Complete trash product.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Cute but waaayyyy too small
customer_reviews.text: These are very cute but i ordered a 7 (likemy other tevas) and thèse wouldn’t even close over my foot. I dont ave wide or fat feet and honestly I felt like they were 2 sizes too small. I almost thought they sent me a child size. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: E.E.

customer_reviews.title: toe loop keeps tightening, but good arch support and comfy cute shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love them, except for some reason the toe loop tightens a lot when I walk and I annoyingly have to keep stopping to pull it loose. Not sure what's up there, maybe it's my foot. But the white and black ones go with everything and have good arch support.
customer_reviews.author: mack

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but....
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of Chacos and I was so excited to get them. They are cute on, and the arch support is excellent. The thing I don't like is that the strap around the big toe tightens as you wear them to the point of pain, so that I am constantly trying to adjust them to keep circulation going in my toes. The other thing is that the soles are very smooth, so when you use them in water, they don't grip very well (like to river rocks), where I never had that problem with Tevas.
customer_reviews.author: H. Armenta

customer_reviews.title: Fit and comfort and longevity.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of chacos and I knew I wanted this particular style even though they did not have my size (10). So I ordered a size 11 thinking it might be too big. However they actually fit perfectly. Only issue is the with straps. Don’t know what to do the extra strap. Comfort level is actually great for my flat feet. I feel like I can walk in these for hours and they hold up pretty good. Excited to wear them throughout the spring and summer.
customer_reviews.author: willy worinkeng

customer_reviews.title: Super cute and comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for hiking and walking around Disneyland. They did not disappoint. I was worried about the price being too high, but I have enjoyed these shoes and will get a lot of use out of them. My feet are cool and my arch is supported. What a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie P.

customer_reviews.title: The best shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: I typically wear a 9 1/2, but I had to get these in a 9. I had tried some on in stores, then 10's were just too big so I went down 1/2 size. I wore these shoes daily during a long trip to Thailand. I walked everywhere, including rivers, beaches, jungles and city streets - my feet were happy! Plus, they're super cool looking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but found the 6 to allign better with my arch
customer_reviews.text: I'd advise going to a store to try these on. I wear a 7.5, but found the 6 to allign better with my arch. I have to admit, I tried on a pair of these thinking, "okay, lady who is bragging about these awesome shoes. I'm going to try these on to attest as to how, "not a big deal" these are. These are SUCH a big deal! It's the arch that really sells them. Find the pair that fits you there and they will be the most amazing pair of sandals you own!
customer_reviews.author: alv

customer_reviews.title: I love, love
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love my Chaco's!! This is my third pair of Chaco sandals and I also have a pair of closed toed Chaco's for cool weather. The arch support is terrific! I especially like that the sandal straps are adjustable to my own foot.
customer_reviews.author: JMF

customer_reviews.title: Pros are the look of the sandal. There was ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros are the look of the sandal. There was not the support I was expecting and the straps were the biggest issue for me. Seemed to fit my right foot ok but my left strap hung on the ground and I would loosen but it would tighten around my big toe to the point of pain. Couldn't keep these so returned for another brand with lots more support in foot bed and no straps.
customer_reviews.author: DIAN

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable but heavy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these sandals for a trip to Spain but they are so heavy I don't think they will pack well. They are super comfortable and feel like a pair of sneakers. I am happy with them but wish they were lighter The soles are solid so very heavy
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Chacos
customer_reviews.text: The straps are super soft & easy to adjust compared to my ZX/2 classics. They did run a tad bit bigger than my other Chacos, but that might just be because they’re a different style. I would recommend still ordering your normal size, just be weary of that.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: The strap drags the ground
customer_reviews.text: They are adorable! A higher arch than I expected but I have flat feet, I'll get used to them! The onky real issue I have with these is that the strap drags the ground after you make all the adjustments to fit them to your feet. I don't know what to do with the strap! Other than that, good job! I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I did not realize I bought the pizza pattern (sale), but I kept them because my kids love them. I have always wanted a pair of chacos because my sister has had hers for 10+ years . They are super comfortable and great for my beach trip as well as my summer mountain river trip
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Kreisle

customer_reviews.title: LOVE Chacos. This is my first pair and after ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE Chacos. This is my first pair and after wearing them for a few months they are easily some of my most comfortable shoes. As others have said they got more comfortable over time. It took me a while to adjust the fitting and I think it's mostly due to the fact that there are double straps. Also, after wearing them in water they were more difficult to adjust. Honestly, nothing that will keep me from buying more in the future... I'll just go with the one strap.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R.

customer_reviews.title: Happy Mishap
customer_reviews.text: When my Chacos came, I discovered they were neither the size nor style that I had ordered. However, I like the pattern even better, and the size turned out to be better too, so I decided to keep them! I originally ordered a size 7, but got an 8, so my takeaway is: maybe size up? Also, look up YouTube videos on how to adjust the straps, that helped a lot (it took me a few days to really feel comfortable with the straps -- it's all about getting more room in the toe strap so it doesn't dig in). All in all, I love them, my arches are happy, and I'm fortunate that I didn't have to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S.

customer_reviews.title: Wide?
customer_reviews.text: Do not feel like these are wide... labeled wide but my foot still hangs off. Have a 9w but feel as if the arch doesn’t fit right... but 8w is NOT nearly as wide.... seem like a great shoe Hope I can find some that fit me well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Teenage daughter approves
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 15 year old because she has high arches and history of shin splints. These support her feet well and she really likes them.
customer_reviews.author: Ohiomommy79

customer_reviews.title: love them
customer_reviews.text: They look great they fit great they’re comfortable to wear. Definitely much better support than some of the sandals I’ve had before. Love the fact that the straps can be tightened or loosened.
customer_reviews.author: Tyffany Mosley

customer_reviews.title: Great foot bed
customer_reviews.text: Overall very cute and comfortable however if you have a wide foot even the wide isn't very large. I had tried a regular size 9 on in the store and it was just a bit tight- the wide I received is only marginally wider. It's still a great product, but be aware. It's equal to a sneaker for all day comfort, and gives decent traction outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: JSloan

customer_reviews.title: Good for everyday use, will opt for the Clouds next time
customer_reviews.text: These are cute and sensible sandals- great for the beach, short hikes, and active wear. They run a little narrow, so I should have gone with a wide, and the straps occasionally give me blisters if worn for 5+ hours. The soles are a little hard, so if you have sensitive feet, go with the clouds. I didn't think I had sensitive feet, but I will be buying a pair of clouds eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try but not again.
customer_reviews.text: wanted to try these as a friend recommend. normally wear Vionics and would not by another of these as they are difficult to adjust and you must readjust every time you wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Lowcasa

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am a Choco lover I needed a new pair in my life. I would never have picked these in a store but I ended up liking the color much more in person after wearing them a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable although they take a little getting used to. Very sturdy sole and good arch support so for those with foot problems, this is a great sandel to own. Easy to clean. My only issue is that they are impossible to adjust once they get a little dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I marked that the fit is somewhat large because I had previously purchased a pare of Chaco sandals in my normal size and they were too big so I sent those back and ordered a pair a size smaller than I normally wear and they fit perfectly! Love these shoes! When you first start wearing them I suggest you only wear them for a few hours 2 or 3 times and let your foot get used to them. They are the most comfortable shoes ever!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THE Chacos at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the Chacos my daughter has been looking for, at a great price! We had to buy men’s but adjusted the size for the order, and so glad we did. For exactly like expected and has her ready to go to Kenya for missions this summer! The “fake” Chacos weren’t good enough last year. Thanks for offering these affordably!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea O

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sandal
customer_reviews.text: Love these Chaco's. Excellent quality, well made, durable, comfortable, true to picture. My daughter's foot is dainty, so the strap is too long. Other than that, these are fantastic sandals
customer_reviews.author: Scott & Lori Hutchison

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, durable and cute!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are super super comfy! It takes a little while to get used to the arch support that these shoes have, and if too much arch support is problematic for your feet, then you probably shouldn't buy these shoes. But I happen to think that they are extremely comfortable. I also didn't have much trouble adjusting the straps - it took about 5 minutes. Once you adjust them, you won't need to do it again!
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn Powell

customer_reviews.title: Best summer footwear
customer_reviews.text: True to size. 3rd pair I have owned in 20 years and still the best quality summer footwear!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Hull

customer_reviews.title: Back strap too big
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrow heel so the back strap was too big. I researched a way to tighten it but couldn’t find the answer. I returned them and ordered a Big Kid shoe instead.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Conner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect river or beach shoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these!!! Didn’t realize just how adjustable they really are! Have bunions so was worried about the fit & comfortability.. awesome!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cc stu

customer_reviews.title: I love chacos!!! get u a pair!!
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the toe strap. It takes some figuring out. But the colors r super cute and theyre so comfy! My next pair will not have a toe strap.
customer_reviews.author: Sara G

customer_reviews.title: Best sandal
customer_reviews.text: I wore these all last Spring/Summer and I will be wearing them again this year too. They have great support for my flat feet. I also do not have any problems with the straps rubbing. If they get smelly from wearing them all the time I just give them a good scrubbing with soap and water and they are good as ever.
customer_reviews.author: S/S Harber

customer_reviews.title: Adore these Chacos!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived ahead of initial estimate. Easy to adjust to a perfect fit. These sandals will get lots of use. Edit: Any reviewers saying chacos don't fit well hasn't adjusted the straps. The footbed could literally be a foot too long but you could still adjust the straps to a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: MI Oenophile

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but broken
customer_reviews.text: Amazing shoe. Right shoe looked great on. Left shoe would not adjust and was completely unwearable. Unfortunately had to return. Update- I’ve had to reach out to Amazon twice for my return. They received my return over a week ago and I Jason getting told my refund is “en route” buyer beware of you have to return. The price went up and now the shoe is sold out so I can’t even get these replaced! 😭
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe once you break it in.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Chacos now, but did not love them at first. They caused many blisters the first week I wore them. Now that I have broken them in, they are extremely comfortable and have even helped to relieve my plantar fasciitis pain. I would recommend that if you are considering purchasing a pair, opt for the wide sizes unless you have truly skinny feet.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly I like these
customer_reviews.text: I live in tennessee and used to hate the look of these but I am starting to hike more and theres so many rivers and lakes I needed something to I could use in the water with my dog. I absolutely love these. They actually look really cute and are really comfortable. I do have wide feet and I am normally an 8.5 so I sized up to a 9. I am still working on getting the straps the way I like but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: AKL

customer_reviews.title: Land. Road. River.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful and supportive on our trip to Portland Oregon!! We went hiking and white water rafting and I wore my chacos with out breaking them in first and it felt a dweed bit uncomfortable at first but by the end of the hike I feel like it learned my foot!? And I totally jumped off a cliff into a river with my chacos the very next day! No regrets!!
customer_reviews.author: Beheirra

customer_reviews.title: Super cute, great support, and OUTSTANDING durability
customer_reviews.text: I love them! I do wish there were more options without the toe strap but they are adjustable so I cant complain too much. They have great support and OUTSTANDING durability. I have had my other pair for almost 3 years and haven't been gentle on them. I loved them so much, that I wanted more color options!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great arch support and durability; many color/pattern options
customer_reviews.text: These are my first Z2 style Chacos. So far the fit is comfortable and sized as expected if you are used to the Z1/ZX1. Chaco sandals are the only brand I've found that provides the right support for my high arches. They are easy to wash. I'm very happy with the Wicker color/pattern. I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Vermeer

customer_reviews.title: My straps stretched
customer_reviews.text: The strap on this model has stretched by over an inch in just a month’s time to the point I must tuck it in behind my heel or step on it while walking. I have two other pair with straps that did not stretch.
customer_reviews.author: P. Tom

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these! I wore them while kayaking and hiking in Colorado and they were comfortable the whole time. Ran just 1/2 size small and the arch is very high which gave a lot of support.
customer_reviews.author: Keyla

customer_reviews.title: Great arch support in these sandals
customer_reviews.text: Chaco sandals, and these are no exception, are great for people who overpronate and are helpful in areas of posture and back problems. I wear them daily whether working outside or working indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Joya

customer_reviews.title: Arch support is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Gave 3 stars for now because I haven't really worn them outside yet, just been trying to adjust the straps and get used to them walking around the house. The sandals are comfortable and I really like the arch support! I will update my review after wearing them for a while...but so far so good! UPDATE: 060118 - Like these sandals a lot!! Wore them the whole Memorial Day weekend; paying our respects & visiting my Dad at Miramar National Cemetery, driving around, window shopping then going to the grocery store; my feet and legs did not feel hurt or tired. I really like the arch support on these sandals. I give it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: M. K.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: A little bit too narrow, but they were sold out of wides. So if you have a wide foot... You’ve been warned 😂 Still in love with these shoes though 💜
customer_reviews.author: Tiffanie

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These are totally worth the price! I thought that it would be a break in period just like most of the shoes I buy but not with these! They are super comfortable as soon as you put them on!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect once you find your size
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought these in size 10, but ended up having to exchange for a size 9. I usually wear a women's size 10.5 to 11 in sneakers, so these were definitely bigger than expected. Other than that, they are perfect for what I needed, a shoe that is comfortable, good for light hiking, and good to get wet.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, would purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: I like Chacos for the arch support. These are easy to adjust. I can fit 7 1/2 to and 8 depending on the shoe, I bought these in an 8 and they fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke_ag

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable even wet
customer_reviews.text: My daughter recommended these sandals to me. At first I was skeptical. However the first time I wore them I went to an outdoor concert and it rained. They were great, I kept my footing in the rain they dried fast and were comfortable even wet.
customer_reviews.author: Violet McInnes

customer_reviews.title: Love these sandals .
customer_reviews.text: Amazing fit. These sandals are so comfy. The pattern is so cute. I will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mt

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand. I have sandals that are still in great shape and perfect support for my Foot. The color pn this pair are rockin.
customer_reviews.author: pam milam

customer_reviews.title: Shouldn’t have shipped this item defective
customer_reviews.text: The right shoe fit fine. The left shoe is defective, the canvas straps are not the same on left as right. I couldn’t get my left foot into the straps.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Hudzik

customer_reviews.title: Worth ordering- but fit may need tweaking
customer_reviews.text: I returned these. I had tried on this model in a store, in a color I didn’t want, and then ordered the color here that I was happy with. The sizing was not the same. Even though I adjusted the straps, the heel just seemed too big on these.
customer_reviews.author: CousinRose

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Really uncomfortable and cause blisters. The footbed is "humped" in the middle and not natural to the sole of my foot. Disappointed that these are not wearable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pick about strap design!
customer_reviews.text: I've loved my chacos for years, but I hate this pair. The straps look cool but their texture is too smooth, 15 minutes after adjusting the straps perfectly they are tight on the toes again and incredibly uncomfortable. Tried sending them through the wash, but that didn't help. Unfortunately I think it's too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with these, love the shoe and love the print. They are a little heavy, but for the protection of my feet I don't mind. I spent 1 month in Thailand only wearing these and they worked great! We walked about 10 hours a day in cities and in forests. Had a few days of break in time to get my feet used to the texture on the foot bed. Make sure to play around adjusting these when walking for the first few days/week and you'll find the perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: SierraM

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first pair of Chaco sandals, and I love the brand so much I keep getting more! These are great for me because I have joint problems, and the amount of support in Chaco sandals allow me to be on my feet almost all day without being sore. Definitely a 10:10 for me!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Jones

product_meta.title: Chaco Women's Z2 Classic Athletic Sandal
product_meta.description:
Streamlined and dependable since 1989, our Classic series is comprised of only 8 component parts, making for the simple, timeless sandal design that made our name. Every pair comes standard with adjustable straps that custom-fits to your foot, a toe-loop for additional forefoot control, plus our podiatrist-certified LUVSEAT PU footbed for all-day comfort and support. Now featuring ChacoGrip rubber for our best performing Classic outsole to date. Experience our Classic Sandal like never before

Since 1989, Chaco has been creating great fitting product that outlast the competition - footwear that can be repaired rather than pitched into a landfill. Chaco focuses on fit, function, comfort and quality with a full line of footwear, including hiking and river sandals, free-heel casual sandals, flips and new for 2007 a children's collection. All Chaco footwear features a biocentric footbed and has received the APMA Seal of Acceptance. Chaco maintains a triple bottom line of people, planet and profit, donating 3% of after-tax profits to organizations dedicated to caring for people and the planet.
feature_bullets: Classic athletic sandal featuring woven straps and nubby footbed
